page.title: 12FARMING MACHINERY(CHEMICALS)
page.content: On the large farm which specialises in malting barley,quality rather than quantity is the priority and fewer sprays are used than on the smaller farm which is geared to high yields. Less nitrogen is used on barley for malting than for feed.Hence the larger farm has fewer machines.The smaller farm's machinery is all geared to a 16 metre tramline;the lack of seeds along these lines shows the way for all the machinery thus avoiding damage to the crop.Machines are high so that the cereal can be sprayed with fungicide against mildew and ear diseases; a growth regulator keeps the straw short so easier to bale.The sprayer with its folded arms in the barn resembled a locust! Weeds are eradicated before ploughing, harrowing and drilling.The new combine harvester cost Â£50,000.
